body:
SAO PAULO, April 18 (Reuters) - Brazilian aircraft manufacturer Embraer (EMBR3.SA)(ERJ.N) expects to deliver up to 300 jets from its Phenom line in 2009 and 2010, a company vice president told reporters on Wednesday.

Embraer should deliver between 120 and 150 Phenom jets in 2009, and another similar batch in 2010, Luis Carlos Affonso said.

The Phenom line includes two types of small, luxurious business jets that Embraer is developing.

The Phenom 100 and 300, which seat between four and nine passengers depending on how they are configured, will be ready to go into operation in 2008 and 2009, respectively.

Embraer, short for Empresa Brasileira de Aeronautica, is the world’s fourth-largest commercial jet maker.
header: UPDATE 1-Brazil Embraer sees big deliveries for Phenom jet
